summary: Newfoundland and Labrador is Canada's easternmost province, made up of the island of Newfoundland and the Labrador region. It's the country's 10th province, joining in 1949. The province is home to about 545,000 people, with most living on the Avalon Peninsula. English is the main language, with most residents having English and Irish ancestry. St. John's is the capital and largest city. Before joining Canada, Newfoundland was a separate British dominion. The province is Canada's most linguistically homogeneous, meaning most people speak the same language.
title: Newfoundland and Labrador
